Oakland.United States Post Office (Berkeley, Cal:
The U.S. Post Office, also known as the Berkeley Main Post Office, has been described as a "free adaptation of Brunelleschi's Foundling Hospital." Designed in the Second Renaissance Revival style, the front of the building features terra cotta arches supported by plain tuscan columns. The building, located, 2000 Allston Way Berkeley, California, was built in 1914-15.
The Post Office is within the Civic Center Historic District, a five block area listed on the National Register of Historic Places.
